rethinkenergy_page.third_heading: Own electricity for hybrid and Use electric cars
rethinkenergy_page.first_page:
The installation of a photovoltaic system with a battery storage and optionally an energy management system is an important decision that should be carefully planned. Currently, there are about 9,000 installation companies in Germany offering photovoltaic systems. The challenge is to find the right partner among these many providers.
The significance of selecting the right installation partner.
The right choice of installation partner is crucial for the efficiency and longevity of your system. Many specialized companies are new to this market and may only have recently gained the necessary experience. It is therefore important to choose a reputable and experienced service provider who is familiar with the specific requirements of your property and the local conditions.
What to consider when choosing:
A good installation partner should thoroughly familiarize themselves with the electrical installation in your home beforehand and obtain specific information about the architecture and orientation of your house. This is necessary to ensure that the PV system is planned and installed optimally. Avoid contact with less experienced companies that may not be able to provide the necessary care and expertise.
renevatec as an example of a brokerage service:
An example of a helpful service is 'renevatec'. This company specializes in identifying the right installation partners in your area. renevatec enables you to compare offers from various service providers to find the best price and performance for your needs. An experienced contact person who guides you through the entire process and offers a long warranty period can be a decisive factor for a successful installation.
Conclusion:
Choosing the right installation partner for your PV system is crucial for its future benefits and efficiency. Take the time to compare offers and choose a partner with proven experience and a good reputation. In the long run, choosing a qualified and reliable partner is an investment in the future of your energy supply and the sustainability of your home.
rethinkenergy_page.second_page:
The investment in a photovoltaic system (PV system) with battery storage not only offers independence from rising electricity prices but also the opportunity to achieve long-term returns. These systems are becoming an increasingly popular choice for homeowners who want to minimize their ecological footprint and financially benefit.
Amortization and return expectation:
A well-planned PV system should typically amortize within about 10 - 15 years. This means that the savings in electricity costs cover the costs of purchasing and installing the system. After the amortization phase, the actual profit phase begins: From the year of amortization, a well-dimensioned system can yield a return of 5 - 10% or more. This return results from the continued savings in electricity costs and possible remuneration for feeding surplus electricity into the grid.
Utilization of the achieved return:
The profits generated can be used in various ways: from further investments in your own home, such as modernizing the building services or buying an electric car, to personal expenses for leisure and travel. Investing in a PV system is thus not only an investment in one's own financial future but also in a more sustainable lifestyle.
Future-proof technology:
The importance of photovoltaics is increasingly important in a world facing the challenges of climate change and resource scarcity. With the impending end of the oil age and the increasing demand for sustainable energy solutions, PV systems offer future-proof technology. They harness the inexhaustible energy of the sun and are completely CO2-neutral.
New technologies in energy generation:
In addition to the direct use of solar power, there is the potential to store renewable energies in the form of hydrogen. This technology allows energy to be conserved for periods of lower solar radiation. Future innovations could allow hydrogen to be converted into other chemical energy carriers such as methane or ammonia during darker months, making the use and storage of renewable energies even more efficient.
Conclusion:
Investing in a PV system is not only economically advantageous but also supports sustainable development. By becoming independent from fossil fuels and generating their own green energy, owners of PV systems make an important contribution to the energy transition and environmental protection. The long-term financial and ecological benefits make photovoltaic systems a smart choice for a secure and sustainable future.
rethinkenergy_page.third_page:
For many homeowners, installing a photovoltaic system is already an important step towards sustainable energy supply for their household. However, the opportunities arising from self-generated electricity go far beyond household supply. In particular, the combination of photovoltaics and electromobility offers significant potential for both ecological and economic benefits.
Cost efficiency and independence:
The charging infrastructure for electric vehicles is being expanded worldwide, and more and more drivers are taking advantage of the opportunity to charge their vehicles with self-generated solar power. Given the high fuel prices – currently gasoline and diesel prices are around 2 euros per liter – self-generated solar power offers a cost-effective alternative. For example, an average electric car requires about 15 kWh to travel 100 kilometers. At a electricity price of 0.20 euros per kWh, the cost for driving 100 kilometers is about 3 euros – a fraction of what one would spend on gasoline or diesel.
Ecological benefits:
In addition to cost savings, the environmental aspect plays a central role. Using electricity from photovoltaic systems to charge electric vehicles is CO2-neutral. This significantly contributes to reducing one's personal carbon footprint and supports global efforts to combat climate change.
Overproduction and its utilization:
A well-dimensioned photovoltaic system of 4-10 kWp can generate between 5000 and 12,000 kWh of electricity annually. Since an average household consumes about 1000 - 1500 kWh per year per person, there is often a considerable surplus. This excess energy can be ideally used for electromobility. Instead of feeding it into the grid, the electricity can be used to charge a hybrid or electric car, drastically reducing the vehicle's operating costs.
Long-term savings:
The annual savings can be significant, especially if you assume an annual mileage of about 10,000 kilometers. Comparing the costs of charging a hybrid or electric car with those of fueling a gasoline vehicle, owners of photovoltaic systems can save several thousand euros annually.
Conclusion:
Switching to electromobility in combination with a home photovoltaic system is already a worthwhile investment today. It not only enables significant savings in operating costs but also supports a sustainable lifestyle. Given the rising energy prices and global climate change, the integration of photovoltaics and electromobility offers a future-proof solution for environmentally conscious homeowners.
rethinkenergy_page.fourth_page:
The installation of a photovoltaic system is a forward-thinking decision that offers not only ecological but also economic benefits. However, the process from planning to commissioning can be complex and challenging. The choice of the right service provider plays a crucial role, as a reliable partner ensures not only the professional installation but also the important communication with authorities and the grid operator.
The importance of reputable service providers:
A reputable service provider is characterized by years of experience, comprehensive expertise, and reliable customer service. In addition, they offer long-term guarantees that strengthen confidence in the quality of the installation and the components used. Such a provider will not only install the system professionally but also handle all necessary registrations and approvals with the market register and the grid operator. These tasks are essential as errors here can quickly lead to lengthy delays.
Challenges in grid integration:
A common problem during the commissioning of photovoltaic systems is grid integration. The system must be accepted and approved by the grid operator before it can be put into operation. This process can be complex, especially if special requirements need to be met or technical adjustments need to be made.

first_page_image.heading: Independence through PV / Photovoltaics
first_page_image.para:
Energy costs are continuously rising, and more and more households are seeking sustainable solutions to reduce these costs while acting environmentally friendly. An effective solution is offered by installing a photovoltaic system with a power storage unit in single and multi-family homes. This system enables households to become independent of fluctuating electricity prices and to utilize self-generated, green electricity.

Full control over energy supply

With a PV system, solar energy is directly converted into electrical energy that can be used in one's own household. The integrated power storage unit plays a crucial role as it stores the energy generated during the day and makes it available even at night or on cloudy days. Especially in the months from February to October, when sunlight is strongest, households can cover the majority of their electricity needs with self-generated electricity.

Economic viability and environmental benefits

In addition to independence from external electricity suppliers and rising energy costs, the PV system with power storage also offers financial incentives. Excess energy that is not immediately consumed can be fed into the public grid. For this, the system owners receive compensation, currently at about eight cents per kilowatt-hour.
Additionally, the economic benefit increases when a hybrid or electric vehicle is integrated into the household. These vehicles can be charged with the excess energy, maximizing the self-consumption of the self-produced electricity and thus further reducing costs.
Promotion of sustainability
The self-generated energy from a PV system is CO2-neutral and significantly contributes to reducing one's own ecological footprint. By using renewable energies, every household with such a system actively supports the energy transition and promotes a sustainable future.
Conclusion
The installation of a PV photovoltaic system with power storage is not only an economically wise decision but also a significant step towards a sustainable lifestyle. It is not only about the independence of an individual household but also about the broader vision of an environmentally friendly and sustainable society.
By using these technologies, we can actively contribute to protecting our environment while also reducing the costs of our daily energy consumption. Therefore, investing in a PV system and an electric vehicle is not only an investment in our own future but also in that of our entire society.

second_page_image.heading: Increase in the value of a property through PV system
second_page_image.para:
The integration of renewable energies into the building technology of properties is evolving from a trend to a standard in the coming years. Particularly, the installation of a photovoltaic system with a battery storage system provides a simple and cost-effective means to drive this development. But what specific advantages does this technology offer in terms of increasing the value of a property?

Long-term profitability and independence
A PV system with a battery storage system is not only an environmentally friendly solution but also a financially wise investment. The system generates electricity over the years, reducing dependence on external energy suppliers and simultaneously lowering energy costs. This independence from rising electricity prices is a significant financial advantage that enhances the attractiveness and value of the property.

Amortization and return on investment
The costs of installing a PV system can be amortized within a few years through savings on energy costs and potential government incentives. After the amortization period, the system begins to yield a return on investment. This return is evident not only in ongoing savings but also in a higher resale value of the property if the owner decides to sell it.

Increase in property value
Properties equipped with a modern and efficient photovoltaic system have a clear advantage in the market. Future buyers are increasingly interested in sustainable and energy-efficient homes, which boosts the demand and thus the price of properties equipped with a PV system. Moreover, such properties are often sold more quickly than comparable ones without corresponding technological features.

Sustainability as added value
The societal movement towards greater sustainability further enhances the value of a property equipped with a photovoltaic system. Potential buyers evaluate

third_page_image.heading: Economic efficiency of PV systems and energy management systems
third_page_image.para:
The installation of a photovoltaic system not only offers the opportunity to generate environmentally friendly energy but also the chance to actively reduce your own electricity costs and even generate profits. A key aspect of this is the use of an Energy Management System (EMS), which gives you full control over your photovoltaic system, energy storage, and the purchase of electricity.
Optimal use during the dark months
Especially in the low-light months of November, December, and January, intelligent energy management is crucial for the profitability of your PV system. During these months, when sunlight is minimal, the energy management system enables optimized use of stored electricity. During the nighttime, when grid electricity demand is low and electricity prices decrease, the storage can be charged cost-effectively. This electricity is then used during the day when electricity prices are higher, leading to significant cost savings.
Intelligent charging and consumption
The energy management system allows you to control your consumption so that you buy electricity when it is cheapest, often even for free or with a credit when the grid has excess capacity. This often occurs in the summer, on windy and sunny days. Such systems can be set to be smart automatically deciding when to buy or store electricity based on price thresholds you set.
Direct redirection of electricity to the household and electric car
Another advantage of the energy management system is the ability to efficiently utilize directly generated electricity during full sunlight and low current household electricity demand. For example, the system can automatically redirect excess electricity to your electric car, maximizing self-consumption and further reducing dependence on the grid.
Conclusion
The combination of a PV system and an energy management system provides a robust solution for maximizing the profitability of your energy investment. By efficiently controlling and utilizing self-generated as well as purchased electricity, significant savings can be realized, and even profits can be generated. These technologies not only contribute to reducing your electricity bill but also promote a sustainable lifestyle through increased use of renewable energies.

about_us_page.heading: About us!
about_us_page.para: At renevatec, we are committed to helping both private households and companies find the ideal photovoltaic solution. Through our free and non-binding solar check, we identify tailor-made offers that perfectly suit your needs. We are your experts for photovoltaic solutions! Would you like to find out more? Arrange a consultation appointment with us now or use our free PV check.

service_page.heading: Renevatec- Our Approach!
service_page.para: Our goal is to not only present you with offers, but to offer tailor-made solutions that are precisely tailored to your individual requirements.
service_page.list:
• - Data Protection: Your data will be treated confidentially and will not be passed on to third parties indiscriminately.
  • - Experience: Benefit from our many years of extensive industry knowledge.
  • - Personal Service: Our experts are available to answer all your questions and work with you to develop the best possible solution.
  • - Independence: Achieve independence from rising electricity prices and secure an independent energy supply.
  • - Increased Value: Investing in photovoltaics not only increases your independence. We guarantee that every PV system with storage will pay for itself as the only building technology system.

agb:
Terms and Conditions - General Terms and Conditions RENEVATEC IS A BRAND OF - GTSPORTS GMBH

Scope of Application

1.1. These General Terms and Conditions (hereinafter referred to as 'GTC') of renevatec - GTSports GmbH apply exclusively to all business relationships. We only accept deviating conditions from the customer if we expressly agree to their validity in writing.

1.2. For the purposes of these GTC, a consumer is any natural person who concludes a legal transaction for purposes that can predominantly be attributed neither to their commercial nor their self-employed professional activity. A business entity, on the other hand, is any natural or legal person or a legally responsible partnership that acts in the exercise of its commercial or independent professional activity when concluding a legal transaction.

Inquiry Submission

  • 2.1. By submitting an inquiry for a product or service to renevatec - GTSports GmbH, a brokerage contract is established, which includes up to four offers from our partners. This inquiry is free of charge and non-binding for the customer, and any commissions for the brokerage are borne solely by the partners.
  • 2.2. After the inquiry, the customer will be contacted by one of our product advisors to discuss the inquiry in detail and to suggest up to four suitable partners. The forwarding of the inquiry only takes place with the customer's consent.
  • 2.3. For certain products and services, an appointment with a partner can be arranged, which depends on the availability of the customer and the partner.
  • 2.4. Customers are encouraged to pay attention to the instructions during the brokerage process and can adjust their entries at any time until the inquiry is finally submitted or cancel the process.

Receipt of Offers

  • 3.1. Offers are sent to the customer after their inquiry has been forwarded, unless an appointment has already been arranged.
  • 3.2. The speed at which offers reach the customer depends on the complexity of the requested product or service and the processing time of the partner.
  • 3.3. Offers come exclusively from partners in our network that meet strict quality criteria. Each partner undertakes to comply with all relevant guidelines of chambers of crafts, professional associations, and similar organizations towards renevatec - GTSports GmbH. Furthermore, they are only allowed to offer those products and services for which they are officially authorized. Due to the extensive size of our partner network, however, renevatec - GTSports GmbH cannot guarantee the suitability of each individual partner. Therefore, it is the customer's responsibility to verify the suitability of a partner, similar to what would be the case with a direct inquiry without our brokerage.
  • 3.4. The decision on the offer lies with the customer. We do not act as a contracting party; we are intermediaries in these transactions.
  • 3.5. Customers may be asked to provide feedback on the offers and service quality at a later date.

Data Privacy and Data Transfer

  • 4.1. Personal data of the customer is only forwarded to partners with their consent. Transfer to other third parties does not occur.
  • 4.2. Data is processed in accordance with the requirements of German data protection law and the EU General Data Protection Regulation. Further information can be found in our privacy policy.

Customer Responsibilities

  • 5.1. Customers use our brokerage service free of charge but may occasionally be asked to provide feedback and confirm the successful conclusion of contracts.

Warranty and Liability

  • 6.1. It cannot be guaranteed that suitable partners will be found for every customer inquiry.
  • 6.2. Liability for damages is limited to intent and gross negligence, except in cases of injury to life, body, or health.

Final Provisions / Limitation of Liability

  • 7.1. Liability for damages is subject to legal requirements, but with the following restrictions and exclusions:
  • 7.2. renevatec - GTSports GmbH assumes unlimited liability if the damage is attributable to intentional or grossly negligent conduct. Furthermore, renevatec - GTSports GmbH is liable for slight negligence in the breach of fundamental obligations that endanger the achievement of the purpose of the contract or in the breach of obligations whose fulfillment enables the proper execution of the contract and on whose fulfillment the customer regularly relies. In such cases, however, liability is limited to the foreseeable, typically occurring damage. renevatec - GTSports GmbH is not liable for slight negligence in the breach of other obligations.
  • 7.3. The aforementioned limitations of liability do not apply in cases of injury to life, body, and health, in the event of defects after assuming a guarantee for the product, and in cases of maliciously concealed defects. Liability under the Product Liability Act remains unaffected by this.
  • 7.4. Insofar as liability of renevatec - GTSports GmbH is excluded or limited, this also applies to the personal liability of its employees, representatives, and vicarious agents.
  • 7.5. renevatec - GTSports GmbH is not responsible for breaches of duty that arise within a contractual relationship between the customer and a partner.

Data Protection

  • 8.1. Data protection policies of renevatec - GTSports GmbH: renevatec - GTSports GmbH processes personal data of customers for specific purposes and in accordance with applicable legal provisions. Detailed information on the type, scope, and purpose of data processing can be found in our privacy policy, available at: URL to the privacy policy.
  • 8.2. Rights of data subjects under the GDPR
    • 8.2.1 Right to information: Customers can request information from renevatec - GTSports GmbH at any time about the personal data stored about them in accordance with Art. 15 GDPR.
    • 8.2.2 Right to rectification: Customers have the right to immediately request the correction of their incorrect personal data.
    • 8.2.3 Right to erasure: Customers can request the erasure of their data under the conditions of Art. 17 GDPR, especially if the data is no longer necessary for the original purposes or has been unlawfully processed.
    • 8.2.4 Right to restriction of processing: Customers have the right to request the restriction of processing of their data, for example, if the accuracy of the data is contested by them.
    • 8.2.5 Right to notification: If correction, erasure, or restriction of data processing has occurred, renevatec - GTSports GmbH is obliged to notify all recipients to whom the data has been disclosed.
    • 8.2.6 Right to data portability: Customers have the right to receive their data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format.
    • 8.2.7 Right to withdrawal: Customers can withdraw their consent to data processing at any time.
    • 8.2.8 Right to object: Customers have the right to object to the processing of their data at any time for reasons arising from their particular situation.
    • 8.2.9 Right to lodge a complaint: Customers can contact the competent supervisory authority in case of complaints.
  • 8.3. If customers wish to exercise their data protection rights or obtain further information about these rights, they can contact us using the following contact details:
    • Email: datenschutz@renevatec.de
    • Address: renevatec - GTSports GmbH, Eiswerderstr. 18, 13585 Berlin

Consumer Information

  • 9.1. renevatec - GTSports GmbH stores the contract text and provides it to the customer in text form, for example, by email or in printed form after the service has been provided. Customers have the opportunity to print or electronically save the contract text before placing an order by using the print or save function of their browser.
  • 9.2. The language of the contract is German.
  • 9.3. European Commission's online dispute resolution platform for consumers: http://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr/. renevatec - GTSports GmbH is neither willing nor obliged to participate in dispute resolution proceedings before a consumer arbitration board.

Right of Withdrawal and Withdrawal Form for Consumers

Right of Withdrawal
As a consumer, defined as any natural person who concludes a legal transaction for purposes that are predominantly neither commercial nor self-employed professional, you have the right to withdraw from this contract within fourteen days without giving any reason. The withdrawal period is fourteen days from the day the contract is concluded. To exercise your right of withdrawal, you must inform us, renevatec - GTSports GmbH, Eiswerderstraße 18, 13585 Berlin, Email: info@renevatec.de, Telephone: +49 (0)30 206 54797, by means of a clear statement (e.g., a letter sent by post or email) of your decision to withdraw from this contract. To meet the withdrawal deadline, it is sufficient for you to send your notification of exercising your right of withdrawal before the withdrawal period has expired.

Consequences of Withdrawal
If you withdraw from this contract, we have to refund all payments we have received from you, including delivery costs (except for the additional costs resulting from your choosing a different type of delivery than the cheapest standard delivery offered by us), immediately and at the latest within fourteen days from the day we receive notification of your withdrawal from this contract. For this refund, we will use the same means of payment that you used for the original transaction, unless expressly agreed otherwise with you; in no case will you be charged any fees for this refund. If you have requested that the services begin during the withdrawal period, you must pay us an appropriate amount, which corresponds to the proportion of the services already provided up to the time you notify us of the exercise of the right of withdrawal concerning this contract compared to the total scope of the services provided for in the contract.

Sample Withdrawal Form

Final Provisions

  • 11.1. The place of jurisdiction and performance is the registered office of renevatec - GTSports GmbH if the customer is a merchant, legal entity under public law, or special fund under public law.
  • 11.2. For customers who are entrepreneurs, German law applies, provided that there are no mandatory consumer protection regulations to the contrary.
